content: 2 inches less than desired length ideally ending after round 2 10 or 14 of the pattern for it to look its best as in the sample though it is possible to end on any round toes set-up remove bor marker knit to end pm at the beginning of the instep stitches this is now your new bor round 1 k1 ssk knit to last 3 stitches of instep needle k2tog k1 repeat on sole needle 4 stitches decreased 2 per needle round 2 knit to end of round repeat these 2 rounds until 24 stitches remain per round 12 stitches per needle graft remaining stitches together using the kitchener stitch *don t forget to wet block your new socks for the best fit and for the pattern to settle in place and look its best happy knitting special instructions for shorties cuff using either cuff option working 12 rounds only leg work only rounds 1 and 2 of the force flowing pattern following instructions for the right or left leg as you need then go straight to the heel flap instructions work the rest of the sock according to the main instructions #disturbanceintheforcesocks page 9 of 12 marie-elyse dugal designs charts please make sure you are following the charts for the correct foot right or left both for the cuff and for the force flowing leg/foot pattern right cabled cuff 8 stitches repeated to end of round \\\\ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 4 ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 3 ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 2 ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 1 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 symbols 🔲 knit ⚫ purl \\\\ c4f left cabled cuff 8 stitches repeated to end of round medium size only small and large sizes ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ //// 4 //// ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 4 ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 3 ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 3 ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 2 ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 2 ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 1 ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ ⚫ 1 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 8
